column1: text

All about the Bass My 7yr old son and 6yr old daughter love to hear her music it's very 
upbeat and this song should be a tribute to all little girls and women . No 
one should make them selves sick trying to be what they are not. I tell my 
children love comes from within,don't judge a book by its cover.My 2older 
sons hear this song and say mom not again but I say listen to her .Kids 
today need people who tell the truth in music so they listen,not the 
garbage music that talks about sex ,drugs and money .thank you.

Awful x100 Simply awful. Not worth the hype she gets by any extent. Save your money 
and your time.

Great music Haters are going to hate. I love that she is being positive for young 
girls and adults. Truth hurts and its a fact people don't like the truth!

The more I hear... The more I hear, the more I love Meghan Trainor! Her 50's inspired music 
has that fun catchy beat that you just can't help but dance to! It brings a 
smile to my face every time I hear her music! And I just love watching my 
daughter, her Girl Scout troop, and all her other friends dancing and 
singing along to these great songs! Such positive messages for everyone - 
reminding us all to love and respect ourselves no matter our physical 
features!

Hope this is just a preview! I look forward to more from her. This EP has a catchy updated 50s feel to 
it but its MUSIC. The stuff that you can actually swing your hips and move 
your feet to, not booty shake. The lyrics are clear with a positive message 
so sing along and enjoy your day. This is a refreshing change to the pop 
scene.

She's going places... My daughter, boyfriend, and I all enjoy all about that bass. She 
incorporates a trinidadian/carribean flare with doo-wop and pop. I feel 
like she encorporates fun and a bit of humor to her songs which makes it 
fun and enjoyable for her listeners as well. She has had much experience 
writing hits for other famous artists and I am glad she is getting her time 
to shine. I can't wait to hear more from her. (ps. anyone who says that 
they like all about that bass and say that her other songs thus far are 
nothing like it clearly cannot hear all the same influences that you hear 
in her debut song...)

Sweet Talk about sweet beats. I mean there really good. I listen to these songs 
like every single day. People who say these songs are stupid are wrong and 
judge mental.

Seen it before These lyrics sound like they were taken off of Twitter and the music isn't 
very unusual. Heard it already. This entire song is pretty typical.

Love her spunk!! Awesome lyrics & great classic beats. No matter the subject always upbeat. 
Just makes you want to tap your foot & sing along.

Nice but.... I like this album and I am only on the first song but I hate how you have 
to pay 3.00 to listen to a songs

Catchy, True, Fun!! These songs are so great! Beat is very catchy and fun to dance/sing to and 
the lyrics are so supportive and true, definite words girls and women need 
to be hearing. :) This lady is a must hear!!

I love it... All about that bass was amazing. I liked it and thought was super 
catchy... At my school we always have a fun day every Wednesday and we 
always have a dance off... For the dance off the school picked All about 
that bass! It was so cool.

Leave her alone She is saying like the other person said love me for who I am and like my 
body big. And that's ok with me

Love her sound She has such an original sound. What a talent. Being a singer myself I'm 
very picky. Cant wait to hear more from her.

Great fun music I got 4 songs of Meghan Trainor is Close Your Eyes Dear future husband 
Title and all about that bass. Thanks

Future Husband That song is ridiculously catchy! Though, 'All About That Bass' is a bit 
hypocritical however, its a good song.

Good stuff Out there and direct I like it. Tired of the stations over playing her 
"all about that bass"

Breath of fresh air So different from anything else right now. It's fun, just makes me want to 
get up & dance!

Eh The other songs don't really add much reason to enjoy her music at this 
point. It sounds good but not captivating.

Meghan Trainer Brings a little of rock n roll to her songs Elivs Presley feel good music 
keep it don't change Meghan love it♥♥
I love Meghan Trainor! It'd not Just her music that's beautiful, she is too. Catchy, fun, spunky, 50s-ish and just awesome!!!!

Awesome!!! Love her album!! The songs are great and very catchy! Love some of the 
positive messages they send through for example in All about that bass - it 
talks about how women should flaunt their beauty, and that they shouldnt 
hide it and be embarassed for their shape/size.

Catchy! Love this, can't wait to hear what comes next from her. The oldies style 
pop music is so catchy, you can't help but love it.

Because you know I'm all about that bass All about that bass is an amazing song. Not just that song, but all of 
them! She has a really pretty voice and the songs make you wanna get up and 
dance/sing to them all day long. Can't wait for the next album of Meghan's!

Nice If you think this whole EP sounds the same then you obviously don't listen 
to the lyrics. This is pure genius I can't wait for a full length Lp.
Wow I'm speechless! I'm lovin' it. :)
Love Meghan. Trainor I have this song dear future husband stuck in my head

Clever, funky, eclectic I've listened to all 3 songs plus all about that bass on Pandora and 
they're catchy, fun, and enjoyable to jam to.

I love her voice As some one who likes vocalists that bridge a musical gap, I find it 
refreshing that she's bringing duwop back into mainstream

You tell it girl! I love her lyrics and I love her style. Classic tunes full of modern self 
esteem, confidence and cuteness. I can't wait for more songs from her!
:) She's on the right track cant wait for more music as she improves!
It was a amazing kids album I hope evrebody likes it
Awesome Guys you do an awesome job keep it up :)
Awesome!!!!!!

Back to their best Turn it up, sit back and immerse yourself. After a couple of plays I am 
hooked. Everyone has their favourite Muse album for whatever reason. Enjoy 
each one in their own right. Right now I'm enjoying this one. A bonus for 
me, my son bought me the vinyl double album which also looks great...very 
Pink Floyd looking but I'm not complaining.

Drones By other band standards: EXCEPTIONAL. By Muse standards: I expected 
better. Only a few songs speak to the musical complexity and originality 
previously showcased. The album's concept sounds edgy but falls flat. 
Instead of originality, the album has mixed audio clips and proven-to-sell 
lyrics made palatable to US teenagers. Bellamy's edginess sounds tamed by 
the industry, and even the token Muse rift can't make this seem little more 
than a homage to their previous work.

This is some of the ballsiest albums I've ever had the chance to hear. I 
feel like Muse has moved into Tool/any Maynard territory, where the music 
is always top notch, but the story painted by the lyricist is equal in 
importance. On top of it, imagine any of this live? As Muse always brings 
it, up on another plane

:D I have been waiting for this album since 2012 when The 2nd Law came out, 
and I swear to the heavens and back it was very much worth the wait. For 
me, it is right up there with Origin of Symmetry (which is my now joint 
favourite album). It tells such a powerful story, and it is a clever mix of 
new and old styles. (I personally love the song Reapers. Definite rec, 
there.)

Fantastic Storyline For me this album told the story of a past rough relationship I had and 
helped me move past it. This album goes to show Muse can constantly shake 
up their routine and kill it doing so! Great guitar great drums great bass! 
You wont be disappointed

My Favorite Muse Album I love the rock sound Muse had on Absolution and Origin of Symmetry, but 
also the more pop sound of The 2nd Law and The Resistance. Drones is my 
favorite because it has both. Reapers, Dead Inside, The Handler and Psycho 
are my favorites. I would strongly recommend a listen.

Got it a few days early and this is one fantastic album. It is much closer 
to Absolution and Black Holes and Revelations bringing a lot more heavy 
rock and experimental pieces that will surprise the listener. Some songs 
take a few listens to feel the deep nature of them, but once understood, 
each song is a force to be reckoned with. From the gritty sounds of Handler 
and Psycho to the ear bliss of Aftermath, Mercy, Drone and The Globalist, 
any listener can find gold here. I couldn't recommend it enough. stop 
whatever your doing and BUY THIS ALBUM.

Muse Does It Again. The songs with exceptional melodic, harmony, with superb selection of 
lyrics. I always find myself listening to their music as load as I can play 
on ear buds. Then covering my ears to enjoy the full effect that delivers 
all the way to my core or soul. Time is of nothing when listening.

Don't get me wrong but I love Muse and I love this album but compared to 
some of their other albums, this one just can't quite compete. Songs such 
as Psycho, The Handler and Dead Inside i can't stop listening to, kinda 
like diamonds in the rough. Buy this album and buy the rest.

My favourite muse album to date This treasure trove of filthy muse goodness just passes origins of 
symmetry as my favourite album. The only problem is you get a sense that 
muse listened too much to the people who hated the 2nd law. As good as the 
heavy stuff is I also like Muse's electronic side and would have loved to 
see 1 or 2 electronic songs in here

Unfortunate It's unfortunate that this album is so weak (as a whole). I'm not the 
first to say it but aside from a few choice tracks it left me wanting more 
than it was prepared to offer. At least their back catalogue is still up to 
the task.

A worthy entry to their Discography I can't recal how many times I skipped a track from MUSE's previous 
effort. With this album the songs seem to stick waaay better. If you have 
listened to MUSE before you can expect those little synth appregios, Dom's 
drum tom thumping, and Queen-like vocals. The biggest let down is that the 
energy wanes a bit towards the middle. Still Drones is a much more valiant 
and solid effort than The 2nd Law.

Gotta say I'm a little disappointed Yes Muse is an awesome artist and my favorite, but after listening to 
their music for year, this album feels like is could have been much more 
great. I don't get that same feeling as when listening to their older 
albums. This isn't saying that this album doesn't contain some great songs, 
because it does.

Better than what I expected and back to top form Well what can I say seen Muse live 7 times and I was a bit sceptical about 
this new album as I wanted them to go back to heavy stuff, but I really 
like this album back to there best!!!. Psycho Reapers and The Globalist are 
just aswome tracks, can't wait to see them live again!!!

Muse has lost the magic They've continued their downward spiral with this one... Just a few decent 
tracks here, and they don't have the longevity of Muse's earlier 
pre-Resistance efforts.

If you are already a Muse fan, you will LOVE this album. If you aren't 
already a Muse fan and like amazing music, you will LOVE this album. If you 
are deaf, ignore everything I just wrote because I don't want you feel bad 
for missing out on being able to hear this album. If you are temporarily 
deaf, let this be the first thing you listen to when you become undeaf. If 
you are a drone, you will not like this album. 5/5, will listen again... 
and again, and again, and again... and again, and again, and again, and 
again. AND AGAIN.

YES!! This album is awesome! It tells a story throughout. Good mix of rock and 
even a little pop-rock. Drones was a little.... well... it's a capella. 
Yeah. It grew on my though! The entire album is awesome! Haters are dumb. 
Yes it isn't anything new.... but I like the sound.

One of the Best In my opinion, this is the best album Muse have produced since BH&R, with 
almost every track being a classic. I haven't ever actually had a muse 
album where there hasn't been a track I dislike, and it's the same story 
here. On showbiz it was escape, OOS it was screenager, Absolution it was 
ruled by secrecy, BH&R it was soldiers poem, The resistance it was guiding 
light and on 2nd law it was explorers. On drones however, it has been the 
only album with more than one song I would instantly skip, with 3.

#showmeyourwarface An album of epic proportions. Opinion to opinion is a mixed bag but to me 
this is definitely top 3 of muse best. I'm so happy that Muse have gone for 
a heavier sounding album much like linkin park did with the hunting party 
and maybe an influence or two from how awesomely rocking royal bloods debut 
album was. Personal highlights are psycho, the handler & defector + mercy 
gave me a starlight vibe & reapers can only be listened one way: LOUDLY!!!!

I LOVE THIS ALBUM! I have listened to Muse for a while now, and I've heard all of their 
albums. I'm so glad they've gone back to their old style opposed to the 2nd 
Law album. This album is so great! I've been listening to it for weeks. I 
love it

It's OK I love these guys. But gotta say I wasn't really wowed with this one. 
Probably 3 or 4 good tracks, the rest are somewhat subpar. I went back to 
The 2nd Law after listening to this one.

An amazing album. I loved this album. It was way more than I could have expected. But it's 
so unfortunate that my pre-order was mysteriously cancelled against my will 
and I had to find other means to finally listen to it.

In all seriousness, these guys are great musicians! However, this album 
sounds like all of their previous albums with a dash of buttrock riffs to 
make it sound like it's different from the others. This is isn't 
progressive rock. It's regressive rock.

A good album by it's own right...but with only 3 or 4 memorable tracks it's 
one of Muse's weaker outings. There are some solid 'classic' Muse riffs as 
well as moments that remind us of Absolution and Black Holes, but overall 
most of the tracks feel uninspired and smell of a meddling producer.

Amazing album I've been a big fan of Muse since 2003! every song on this album flows 
together and tells a story of rebellion, kings and queens, and government 
conspiracies.

Meh and slow Why so slow....putting me to sleep. His voice needs a tone down since the 
music is way better. He is part of the band not the best part. One song 
even sounds exactly like a previous song sung. Dissapointing. I loved their 
earlier stuff and still wish I could mute his vibrato long notes. Geez.

This is such an amazing album and I absolutely love all the songs, which is 
usually rare for me. It features a nice blend of pure rock with influences 
from music pioneers in general, or at least that's what I hear. 
Additionally, the album has a compelling story, told from song number one 
all the way to the very last track, a fact you can see just by looking at 
the songs' titles. Listen to the lyrics and you have a complete saga. For 
any fan of Muse, this is a must. For everyone else, this is also a must. 
Enjoy!

Muse got rid of 90% of electronics and got back to basics. Guitar, base and 
drums. The album is perfect and in the same ballpark as Resistance and 
Black Holes and Revelations.

This album is awesome Starts off with a mixture of rock music, gets a bit heavier before 
becoming relaxing, almost Pink Floydish, it's awesome, wasn't too sure 
about "Drones" as acapella, but it's a unique way for Muse to close a fine 
album. Good stuff. My favorite is Defector.

Another Solid Album This album really grew on me after a couple of listen throughs. Definitely 
recommend.

Great but... This album has some amazing songs like psycho and dead inside which hark 
back to their origins like what was promised. However other songs like 
mercy, though amazing, don't fit the same genre and whilst most are good, 
Revolt is quite possibly the worst song I've heard all year which is a real 
shame. Also as JFK, Drill Seargeant and Drones aren't really tracks, be 
aware you'll only be getting 9 actual songs. But it's Muse so still worth 
it

Solid album Doesn't blow me away, but the last two albums I grew into over time until 
I picked up the addiction - this may happen here. The only song I dislike 
is dead inside which feels flatter than the normal Muse roller coaster - 
great video though

Yet another masterpiece! I love this album so much. The songs are a great mixture of what made 
their old albums great and the new sounds of their newer ones. And the 
theme of the lyrics is also very relevant. You won't regret getting it!

Chris Very disappointed! I was hopping and expecting so much..oh well "UPDATE" 
After a few listens, I have completely changed my mind! I now live it

I'm completely disappointed with this album. Tons of cliche. Music is poor 
and dull. I think Muse should step aside from politics. There is nothing 
memorable about this album. Sad.

Returned to their roots This is Muse returning to their glory days of OoS and Absolution. 
Completely stoked with this new album. Turn it up loud!

The best rock band I can't get enough of how awesome muse's songs sound. Without a doubt they 
are the best alternative/rock band of the century
Too Expensive Good band but not worth paying a premium for their music.

The Globalist This album has everything you love from muse. Though a weird last song 
(Drones) everything else is put together fantastically. Get ready to catch 
yourself singing the lyrics, tapping your foot, playing air guitar with an 
imaginary Matt Bellamy, and headbanging constantly to the museic.

Wonderful story with amazing melodies First listen through made me question if it was actually Muse, but I loved 
every second of future play throughs. Each track is great on its own and 
complement each other when played in order. Definitely pleased with this 
album!

Lovely Beats. I get the problem people have,(imo) since kaleidoscope dream had his voice 
utilised more. While wildheart has "beautiful exit, waves, leaves" with 
catchy beats good vocals as always that are forgettable & synthesizers and 
not enough of miguel's voice. Coffee among Nwa and HD remind me of 
kaleidoscope dream/art dealer chic esque type songs like adorn or all. I 
reaally wanna hear them live since he always kills it. I still love the 
album though and still a fan. I just know he can do better. :)♥

<3 Miguel ITS not like his other work because he is an artist. He's evolving. He 
can't stay the same. He's different and that's what I love about him. I 
love " Coffee " "Leaves " "a beautiful exit " "simple things ", "what's 
normal anyway "... Man.. I hope to see you in concert! I'm pleased with 
this album!!! <3

This album is trash!!! Anyone that gave this album 5 stars knows nothing about music. I'm tired 
of r&b soul albums sounding like their singing rap lyrics!!! Today's music 
is so bad and this generation should be ashamed!

It's worth the purchase. Coffee, Waves and NWA are my favorite songs on the album. Although it's 
not like his first two I enjoyed the album.

Expected Better I'm a big Miguel fan and this album just really disappointed me. I've been 
waiting for his album for the longest and this is a DROP from Kaleidescope 
Dream

I'm really not sure what happened here. 'All I Want Is You' was pretty 
solid. 'Kaleidoscope Dream' was a remarkable follow-up. 'Wildheart' is just 
underwhelming. I kinda want a refund.

Miguel wild heart By far Miguel's best work to date. It's the kinda of album you could throw 
on and chillax to. Or for some baby making music.

5 star officially the album starts off good and then keep going u will come back for more of 
miguel's..my number one will be 'simple things' second coffee is a topper 
indeed (: no doubt. #summertime

Best R&B Album of 2015 Prince+Lenny+Santa with a pinch of Miss Lauryn Hill you get this amazing 
artist. Miguel has always been ahead of his time and he proves it once 
again with Wild Heart.

Don't sleep People need to give this another listen if they don't like it because it 
is a remarkable album. Can't believe the 1 star ratings. 5 out of 5.

I like it He mad the mood of the album so you can have sex to it and you should be

Not as good as his other albums Older albums are much more unique. This one is OK.

Better than kaleidoscope dream. Classic album. I can listen to this album 4-5 times in a row and not know.

I like it. I don't really care for about 3 tracks on here. Flesh is the standout

Love I really like his work. Wish he received more success.
Its okay Not my favorite album from him but still a good album.
???? Not sure what he was going for with this album. I was really disappointed.

Its a pretty good album Nothing is always going to be the same but music grows on you just like

Just ridiculous Crazy good album.

Omg I love miguel si much more than any one does in this world

Awesome Truly a great album "Do Not Sleep On This One"

Shes Out Of My Life! Seems like he took my feeling about my late mothers death, and put it into

Man In The Mirror MAN IN THE MIRROR is a great song for relaxing and sleeping, not to LOUD

Michael Jackson is my favorite pop star I love him he will always be my

My heart and soul: Michael in tatted in ny heart forever. RIL My KING OF POP.
I love it! But their is no the lady of my life? Love it.

King of pop You will always be king of pop forever RIP michael jackson:)

Michael jackson Omggggggggggggggggggggggggg.I do have money but I am just not alowed to

Happy Birthday Michael We will never forget your love
Aaliyah The best thing about it is that I know all of Michael Jackson's songs .

Mikey I love you Michael Jackson, I just wish I had been able to go to one of 
your concerts, I miss you

YASSS!!!! I love MJ and his songs are amazing!!! 1 out of 1,000, I would pick 
1,000!!! I REALLY wish I had money to buy this!!! MJ is AWESOME!!!

Michael Jackson MARION Because of your music I have not felt quite alone...I love you!! Rest in 
peace! !
ahowze I agree, this is the greatest song that I have ever heard

BEST ALBUM EVER This is the best album ever produced by em by FAR. People say he went 
soft, but that's complete bull. One listen to cold wind blows and u know 
he's not soft. I have been a hardcore die hard Stan since 4th grade, and I 
know the real slim shady and this is him. This, (Recovery), The Marshall 
Mathers LP, the eminem show, and The Marshall Mathers LP2 are the real em 
speaking amazing lyrics. Not the fake em, on drugs. Anyway, DEFINITELY 
WORTH THE 11.49!!!!!!!!

Eminem at his best. This album is a master piece I thank god we have rapper's like Eminem not 
many can compare to him. This is his best album up to date. That album he 
dropped called "The Hell Sequel" wasn't that great. EMINEM'S - RECOVERY 
ALBUM SHOWS EMINEMS,TRUE PASSION TOWARDS HIP-HOP / RAP.

Eminem recovery I have always been a fan Of Eminem and whenever I heard that he changed 
his flow so I had to check it out.. I liked it compared to what everyone 
was telling me I know a lot of people gave up on Eminem after relapse but I 
liked it it was more of the old em more darker then what normal is use to 
coming from Eminem here lately like with 3 am or medicine ball but hey 
everyone has their own taste in music .. Also glad to here that he is 
getting his life together.. Hope to hear more from em soon :-)

Eminem's Recovery This Album Was Pretty Good. Now First things first. The pros of this 
album. PROS: now this album is really good, he's got a nice flow, amazing 
lyrics, very witty punchlines, and (kinda) the beats, cause some of the 
beats are just meh. Now to get on the Coins. CONS: Guest Appearances from 
basically all the artist I don't like. The Beats like I said before are 
sometimes meh. Summing it all up the albums pretty good but will never be 
as good as his first 3 albums. My favorite song one there is "so bad".

Loving the difference I love it whn I hear the difference in styles tht Marshall puts into his 
style n levels of his rapping... I am amazed with what he creates n I 
always look forward to how Marshall improves on his own lyrics n levels of 
talent!!! Great Job... Marshall!! I knew yu could do it... Keep up the hard 
work n always kno tht yu hav what it takes to make it to the next level of 
challenges....!!

Good album Im not a rap or hip hop fan. However theres some intriguing about how raw 
his music is. On some level i can relate.. The great thing about music is 
it is way for people to expresss them selfs. Not all music is great or 
healthy to listen too. But he is truley being real and that says alot. So 
for people to to negative you are completey missing the point of his 
music....

Eminem once again proves why he is one of the Best The fact Relapse and this album were recorded so close together is 
amazing. I believe Relapse is just as good and Eminem proves his lyrics are 
untouchable. He brings so many hits on this CD and this is THE best 
purchase you can make of any album period. You will not be disappointed and 
probably will be surprised because I believe it to be his best album yet.

Perfection Eminem is the best hands down no questions asked no second guessing no 
nothing. He's the best. But he needs to release that new album redemption

still a comeback for the veteran rapper.
